intro: Urtica alceifolia, commonly known as the lesser nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, characterized by its stinging hairs that can cause skin irritation upon contact. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring alternate, heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Urtica alceifolia is known for its small, greenish flowers that appear in clusters, contributing to its role in supporting local pollinators.
